Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk cockpit
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: cockpit bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: Cockpit is a server administration interface that makes it easy to administer GNU/Linux servers through a web browser. The cockpit packages have been upgraded to upstream version 122, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version. Most notable changes are: Cockpit can now rollback network configuration that would otherwise disconnect an administrator from the system. Unmanaged network devices are now shown. The list of docker containers can be filtered and expanded inline. Cockpit can be a "bastion host" by using the login page to connect to an alternate system through SSH. Only connect to an alternate system if it has a known SSH host key. When connecting to other systems, each SSH connection is run in a separate process. Fixes bugs that prevent the "Logs" page from working in Firefox 49. A network proxy can be used when registering with Red Hat Enterprise Linux subscriptions. (BZ#1338681) A system can be unregistered when using Red Hat Enterprise Linux subscriptions. (BZ#1334723) The default flags for new VLAN devices have been fixed. (BZ#1390605) Users of cockpit are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
